description.value:
Small flecks of mica, sand, and ground glass are packed into a spring-loaded canister that can be rigged to a trip wire or hidden in a container. The first creature to enter the square or open the container must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20|traits:uncommon|showDC:all] save as the area is showered with bright, glittering dust that sticks to skin, fur, and clothing.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a -1 status penalty to Stealth checks for 1 minute or until it uses an Interact action to remove the glitter.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Glittering Snare (Success)]

Failure The creature takes a -2 status penalty to Stealth checks for 2 minutes or until it spends a 2-action activity, which has the manipulate trait, to remove the glitter. If the creature was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Invisible], the glitter outlines it for 1 round, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Concealed] rather than @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Undetected] to visual senses.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Glittering Snare (Failure)]

Critical Failure As failure, but the penalty is -4. The glitter sticks for 5 minutes or until the creature spends a 3-action activity, which has the manipulate trait, to remove it. The glitter continues to fall around the creature until completely removed, leaving a trail behind it as it moves and revealing its rough location; the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Hidden], rather than undetected, to any creature that can see the glitter whenever it would otherwise have been undetected.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Glittering Snare (Critical Failure)]

source.value: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar
